```mermaid
    K[User Interaction] --> I
    I --> F
```

### Data Flow

The data flow follows a structured pipeline from source code to rendered component:

```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[NXML Source] --> B[Parser]
    B --> C[Validated AST]
    C --> D[Layout Engine]
    D --> E[Layout-enhanced AST]
    E --> F[State Store]
    E --> G[Sandbox]
    E --> H[View Registry]
    F --> I[Hydrator]
    G --> I
    H --> I
    I --> J[React Component]
```

## 3. Key Implementation

### Main Entry Points
- `packages/nexus-reactor/src/reactor.ts`: Main reactor class that orchestrates the execution engine
- `runtime/workspace-kernel/src/index.ts`: Entry point for the workspace kernel server
- `packages/nexus-protocol/src/index.ts`: Core protocol definitions and exports

### Core Modules
- **nexus-protocol**: Core type definitions and validation (packages/nexus-protocol)
- **nexus-reactor**: NXML execution engine with reactive state and sandboxing (packages/nexus-reactor)
- **nexus-wasm-bridge**: Rust-based WASM execution environment (runtime/nexus-wasm-bridge)
- **workspace-kernel**: Node.js server managing panels and execution (runtime/workspace-kernel)

### Configuration Approach
- Environment variables for runtime configuration (WORKSPACE_ID, MAX_PANELS, etc.)
- Package-specific configuration files (package.json, tsconfig.json, Cargo.toml)
- Runtime configuration through the workspace kernel (runtime/workspace-kernel/src/config.ts)

### External Dependencies
- **Frontend**: React, TypeScript, Vite (packages/nexus-reactor)
- **Backend**: Express, WebSocket, simple-git (runtime/workspace-kernel)
- **WASM**: WasmEdge, QuickJS, napi-rs (runtime/nexus-wasm-bridge)
- **Monitoring**: Prometheus client, tracing (runtime/workspace-kernel)

### Integration Points
- **Model Context Protocol (MCP)**: AI integration for tool exposure and state inspection
- **WebSocket API**: Real-time communication between client and server
- **HTTP API**: REST endpoints for panel management and state retrieval
- **Git Integration**: Version control for panel definitions and state

### Component Relationship Diagram

```mermaid
graph TD
    A[NXML Source] --> B[Parser]
    B --> C[Validator]
    C --> D[Layout Engine]
    D --> E[State Store]
    D --> F[Sandbox]
    D --> G[View Registry]
    E --> H[Hydrator]
    F --> H
    G --> H
    H --> I[React Component]
    J[AI/NexusOS] --> F
    K[User Interaction] --> I
    I --> F
    L[Workspace Kernel] --> M[HTTP API]
    L --> N[WebSocket API]
    L --> O[Git Service]
    P[WASM Bridge] --> Q[QuickJS Runtime]
    R[Panel Manager] --> S[Panel Instances]
    T[Extension Manager] --> U[External Services]
```

## 4. Key Features

### Functionality Overview
- **Declarative UI**: Define panels using NXML with Data, Logic, and View namespaces
- **Reactive State**: Automatic dependency tracking and fine-grained reactivity
- **Secure Sandboxing**: Isolated execution of handler code with capability-based security
- **AI Integration**: Model Context Protocol for AI tool exposure and state inspection
- **Cross-Panel Synchronization**: Explicit sync workflow with AI-generated patches

### Implementation Highlights
- **NXML Parser**: Converts markup to AST with source location tracking (packages/nexus-reactor/src/parser)
- **Reactive State System**: Proxy-based store with dependency graph (packages/nexus-reactor/src/state)
- **Sandboxed Execution**: Secure handler execution with forbidden global shadowing (packages/nexus-reactor/src/sandbox)
- **Layout Engine**: Deterministic 12-column grid layout calculation (packages/nexus-reactor/src/layout)
- **WASM Bridge**: Rust-based execution environment for secure handler execution (runtime/nexus-wasm-bridge)

### Feature Architecture Diagram

```mermaid
stateDiagram-v2
    [*] --> Idle
    Idle --> Parsing: Load NXML
    Parsing --> Validating: AST Generated
    Validating --> LayoutProcessing: Valid AST
    LayoutProcessing --> StateInitialization: Layout Complete
    StateInitialization --> Ready: State Ready
    Ready --> Executing: Trigger Tool
    Executing --> Suspending: Async Operation
    Suspending --> Resuming: Operation Complete
    Resuming --> Ready: State Updated
    Ready --> Patching: AI Suggestion
    Patching --> Reviewing: User Review
    Reviewing --> Ready: Patch Approved
    Reviewing --> Ready: Patch Rejected
    Ready --> Idle: Panel Destroyed
```
